climbs.name: Whale Tail Pilates
climbs.fa: Jen Payne, Vaino Kodas, Deborah Evans, Mark Ondrias, December 20, 2008

content.description: Start within the corridor between Arniel and Lucia, it's the only route in there so you can't miss it. An interesting move off the ground will get you to an eventual left hand side pull with some reachy moves higher. After clipping the fourth and last bolt climb easy but slightly run out 5.2 to the anchors.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor.

content.description: The crux is probably in the upper portion of the crack.
content.protection: Standard trad rack.  There is a bolt and chain anchor to the right of the last crack moves.
content.location: This is the crack in the corner on the back side of Lucia.

content.description: Of the three aretes, this route follows the middle one. Starting at the base of the arete there is a high first bolt that many may chose to stick clip. Some balancy but not difficult moves will get you to the first bolt. From there, a more difficult move gets you to a large hueco where you can clip your second bolt. The crux comes at the top after clipping your third and final bolt.
content.protection: Three bolts to a two bolt anchor.

content.description: Start to the right of the arete that has Muffin Top Aerobics on it. The route appears to have a boulder perched on the top of it (don't worry, it's solid!). After stepping up to clip the first bolt, reach through a series of sequency pockets and clip the second bolt. Move to the right and clip the third bolt that is at the base of the overhang. Cruz the crux to the top of the boulder  to clip another bolt and a final just before tapping the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor.

content.description: Goofy and fun and a little effort is required.
content.protection: pads and spotters
content.location:
Three-man boulder is SE of Funguy and East of Peck's Mystery.  There is a East-facing, huecoed overhang. 

  This is the far left-hand problem sit starts and goes straight up the South arete.  Problem #1 in the Beer Helmet photo.

content.description:
Clip low first bolt from the ground.  Make a few moves up a weird crack thing to another bolt.  From here head left and clip the third bolt.  Make a large (crux) deadpoint to a decent hold.  Easier climbing and a rest lead past a few more bolts to the anchors. 

  Doesn't get winter sun so best before it is super cold.
content.protection: 5 bolts to anchors. Well protected small runout past third bolt is on super easy ground.
content.location: On the Arniel boulder the furthest boulder to the Northeast.  On the rightside this is the middle route.  Head up a small scree slope between the main boulder and a smaller boulder.

content.description: This route is just left of another 5.11 in the corner of Lucia, and is the better of the two. Start with some tenuous moves to the first bolt (which some may want to clip stick clip). Sustained body tension, tricky foot placements and a tenuous sequence will allow you to reach the pockets above to clip the second bolt. It's not quite over yet as sustained climbing will keep you engaged until the two 5.11 routes converge near the top. Pull a lip and clip the two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Four (?) bolts to two bolt anchor.

content.description: The most worked line on this boulder, prolly because the landing is the least scary.  Also the crux is in the middle.
content.protection: pads and spotters
content.location: Sit start low on the right hand side of the Southwest face of Girl Boulder.  Move up and left, then a long move up and right gets you set up for the crux.  Go straight up.  Problem #3 in the picture.

content.description:
Climb the tall face to the lip then continue up the slab to the top. Work your way off to the left down a featured slab, if you can get up you should have no problem getting down. 

  Tough moves on opposing sidepulls leads to a long deadpoint to a crimp with the right hand. Then a second similar deadpoint with the same hand a move higher. A last intimidating reach for the jugs at the lip and easier to the top.
content.protection: Pads and spotters.
content.location: The middle of the overhanging downhill face of Lucia, or the middle of the 3 sisters.

content.description: Climbs the nice looking arete on the left side of the formation. The business starts low with an nice under-cling to reach and clip the first bolt. A few technical moves get you through the crux and the climbing eases once past the third bolt.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor.

content.description: A little spice makes this problem worth doing.  Crux over the bad landing.
content.protection: pads and spotters
content.location:
Fun Guy boulder sits about 40 yards downhill to the Southeast of Angela, and about 30 yards to the Northeast of Peck's Mystery.  It can be recognized by the mushroom-like appearance from the West. 

  This problem sit starts on the corner of the mushroom stem in a big hueco.  Go straight up through a two-finger pocket and gain the sloping ledge.  Then go right and up using hard to find holds over a landing that will make you think.  Problem #4 in the picture.

content.description: Juggy but the footwork can be elusive.  Crux at the top.
content.protection: pads and spotters
content.location:
Fun Guy boulder sits about 40 yards downhill to the Southeast of Angela, and about 30 yards to the Northeast of Peck's Mystery.  It can be recognized by the mushroom-like appearance from the West. 

  This problem sit starts on the left side of the West face on an unmistakeable two hand hold.  Go up and right to the giant flake and follow it to the top.  Problem #1 in the picture.

content.description: As the name implies, there is a joyous leap on this.
content.protection: pads and spotters
content.location: Center line of Girl Boulder, sit start.  Hard moves take you to a blank section that can be dynoed through.  Problem #2 in the Feeling Merry picture.

content.description: Though the top out is very tall, the crux is only a body length off the ground and then the angle relaxes to just under vertical.  This problem combines the trickier, more powerful alternative start of Edges with a balancy, thin crux to go up to make a more pure and aesthetic line.
content.protection: pads and spotters
content.location: Sit start down in the hole on the South side of the West face of Angela boulder.  Do the long reaches to achieve the heart-shaped two hand flake jug.  Go straight up on small holds using balance and precision, then relax and top out.  Descent to the East and North.

content.description:
A tricky and unstable starting move to get established on the bulge and a challenging finish over the lip at the top may make you let out a grunt or two, but the super easy climbing between will have you breathing easy. Although, you may also sigh because the pro is little bit of a let down (hopefully not literally). 

  If anybody knows the real name of this route, message me and I'll update it. There's also a chance that this is one of those high ball bouldering problems that the Socorro hard man crew gets upset about when somebody puts an anchor in at the top for TRing.
content.protection: All gear. The thin crack at the bouldery start can be protected with a small nut or 0/00 Master Cam. Towards the top, a #2 Camelot can be placed off to the right in an undercling slot and the last moves can be protected relatively safely in an angled slot on the face 3 feet below the anchor (a yellow Master Cam is good for this spot). The rest is creative placements, none of which were all that good, but the climbing is really easy through the middle.
content.location: Five or ten feet left of Chewbacca on the East face of the formation. Across the 15 feet wide gully from Unknown Right. While walking up to Las Hermanas, locate the shiny anchor bolts at the right end of the ledge at the top of the low angle wall. No lowering hardware on the anchor hangers. Walk off carefully to the left at the top or bring some leaver biners.

content.description:
You can use either thuggery or style to get through the pinch on this fun little problem. 

  Rob Slingsby did a harder contrivance by avoiding the ledge at the lip and going straight up the blunt arete on thin and painful edges.  Adds a grade for sure.
content.protection: pads and spotters.
content.location:
Three-man boulder is SE of Funguy and East of Peck's Mystery.  There is a East-facing, huecoed overhang. 

  This problem sit starts on jugs in the middle of the overhang.  Use the pinch to gain the ledge, then top out.  Problem #2 in the Beer Helmet photo.

content.description: Powerful crimping and balance, crux at the top.
content.protection: pads and spotters
content.location: Girl boulder is located just to the East of Chewbacca cave.  This problem sit starts on the left side of the slightly overhung Southwest face.   Go straight up.  Problem #1 in the picture.

content.description:
Sit start on the obvious rail and climb out the steep almost horizontal arete.  After the first few moves you hit a large rail allowing a quick shake, regroup and make a large move to an obvious 2 finger pocket.  Bump the left hand thru good pinches to a great jug in the slot.  From here the topout is easier although awkward and committing.   

  You could follow the chossy easy ground to the top of the boulder, but I traversed way left to an easy downclimb.
content.protection: Pads and Spotters, there are several rocks around the landing zone so spot carefully.
content.location: Follow the established trail to the Las Hermanos area.  This is the obvious cave just East of the Arniel boulder.  As you follow the trail just look left for the chalked overhang.

content.description:
A very long traverse with great moves on some unpleasant holds.  In fact one hold in the middle is somewhat infamous and is dubbed "British Steel".  The top out is a bit tall but can be padded well. 

  The alternate problem is more fun but more pumpy, and avoids the jugs in the beginning using some long, powerful moves to go straight to the double hand flake. 

  Doing the final section on the North face from the stand start to the top is a fun problem on it's own, and goes at about V1.
content.protection: pads and spotters
content.location:
Sit start in a hole on the South end of the overhung West face of Angela.  Do so sequential moves up to a large, juggy hueco.  Then start going left along the face, following the line of weakness. 

  Turn the corner with hands on the lip at the North end of the face, then traverse the crimpy, vertical North wall of the boulder to a dihedral.  Balancy moves to the top out straight up if you have any juice left. 

  Problem #1 in the picture.

content.description:
A little taller and more spicy than the other routes on this boulder.  Crux is past the lip and the landing could be quite bad due to the smaller boulder to your right. 

  I was alone and inebriated when I found this boulder and did this problem.  Not wise.
content.protection: pads and spotters
content.location:
Three-man boulder is SE of Funguy and East of Peck's Mystery.  There is a East-facing, huecoed overhang. 

  This problem is the right-most on the overhang, almost against the small boulder to the side.  Sit start and pull jugs until they disappear at the lip.  Use small edges and balance to get over the lip and top out.  Don't catch your foot on the small boulder if you fall.  Problem #4 in the photo. 

  A harder variation by Keith "Butters" Thomas is to sit start at the far left and traverse right to this problem and then go up.

content.description: This route would be much better if it were more sustained. Just right of another 5.11 on Lucia, the routes are shared at the top. Some tenuous moves take you to the first bolt. After clipping the first bolt, move through the business and make a second clip. A few more moves to some difficult to see holds and the route is pretty much over. Climb through the jugs, pull the lip at the top, and clip the anchors.
content.protection: 4(?) bolts to a two bolt anchor.

content.description: Easy sharp climbing up the arete with large holds around the right side all of the way up. Contrived, as staying right of the arete makes the route 5.5.  No real crux, all of the clips have solid holds.
content.protection: 3 bolts. Anchor at the top for toproping with draws. No chains for lowering but easy to top out and walk off.
content.location: North edge of Arniel. Lies to the right of Climbing Outside the Box. Follow the trail to Las Hermanas and head to the highest boulder.

content.description:
Las Hermanas, or The Sisters, is a collection of 3 large boulders about 40 feet tall.  From South to North (or bottom to top) they are known as Angela, Lucia, and Arniel.  This area has about 15 routes from 5.8 to 5.12.  There are also many opportunities for bouldering. 

  Climbing consists of typical Socorro climbing involving technical moves on crimps and the occasional pocket.  Climbs vary from slabby to slightly overhanging.
